title: Getting Started as a School Administrator

sections.heading: Welcome to AI Engagement Hub
sections.content: As a School Administrator, you have oversight and administrative access across all courses in your institution. This role enables you to manage instructors, monitor institution-wide AI usage, and ensure policy compliance.

sections.heading: Initial Setup
sections.content: Configure your administrative account and institutional settings.

subsections.heading: Account Activation
subsections.content: Your account requires special administrative privileges. Contact the platform support to enable School Administrator status. Complete your profile with institutional details. Configure institution-wide notification settings.

subsections.heading: Institutional Configuration
subsections.content: Set up your school's branding and customization. Configure default AI model availability. Establish institution-wide usage policies. Set budget limits and cost controls.

subsections.heading: Department Structure
subsections.content: Create department categories for course organization. Assign department heads if applicable. Set up reporting hierarchies. Configure cross-department visibility settings.

sections.heading: User Management
sections.content: Comprehensive tools for managing all users in your institution.

subsections.heading: Instructor Management
subsections.content: Grant instructor privileges to faculty members. Assign instructors to departments or programs. Monitor instructor activity and course creation. Revoke or modify instructor permissions as needed.

subsections.heading: Student Oversight
subsections.content: View enrollment statistics across all courses. Monitor overall student engagement metrics. Identify at-risk students across the institution. Generate compliance reports for administration.

subsections.heading: Role Administration
subsections.content: Promote users to various administrative roles. Manage Teaching Assistant assignments. Configure Student Assistant permissions. Maintain role hierarchy and permissions.

subsections.heading: Account Maintenance
subsections.content: Bulk create accounts for new semesters. Deactivate accounts for graduated students. Reset passwords and resolve access issues. Manage account suspension and reactivation.

sections.heading: Course Oversight
sections.content: Monitor and manage all courses within your institution.

subsections.heading: Course Monitoring
subsections.content: View all active courses and enrollments. Track course-level AI usage and costs. Monitor compliance with institutional policies. Generate cross-course comparison reports.

subsections.heading: Course Approval
subsections.content: Review and approve new course creation. Set course-specific AI model restrictions. Establish enrollment caps and prerequisites. Archive completed courses for records.

subsections.heading: Quality Assurance
subsections.content: Review course content and AI usage patterns. Ensure alignment with academic standards. Monitor for policy violations or concerns. Provide feedback to instructors on best practices.

sections.heading: Analytics and Reporting
sections.content: Institution-wide data analysis and reporting capabilities.

subsections.heading: Usage Analytics
subsections.content: Track total AI usage across the institution. Monitor cost distribution by department or course. Identify usage trends and patterns. Forecast future usage and budget needs.

subsections.heading: Performance Metrics
subsections.content: Measure student engagement levels institution-wide. Compare AI adoption rates across departments. Track instructor utilization of platform features. Analyze correlation between AI use and outcomes.

subsections.heading: Compliance Reporting
subsections.content: Generate FERPA compliance documentation. Create audit trails for data access. Monitor academic integrity metrics. Export reports for accreditation reviews.

subsections.heading: Custom Reports
subsections.content: Create tailored reports for stakeholders. Schedule automated report generation. Export data in various formats. Share reports with board members or committees.

sections.heading: Policy Management
sections.content: Establish and enforce institutional AI usage policies.

subsections.heading: Policy Creation
subsections.content: Develop comprehensive AI usage guidelines. Set academic integrity standards. Create model-specific usage restrictions. Establish data retention policies.

subsections.heading: Policy Enforcement
subsections.content: Monitor compliance across all courses. Flag policy violations automatically. Review and address reported concerns. Implement consequences for violations.

subsections.heading: Communication
subsections.content: Distribute policy updates to all users. Create policy acknowledgment requirements. Provide training materials and resources. Maintain policy documentation archive.

sections.heading: Budget and Cost Management
sections.content: Control and monitor institutional AI spending.

subsections.heading: Budget Allocation
subsections.content: Set department or course-level budgets. Allocate resources based on enrollment. Create cost centers for tracking. Establish spending approval workflows.

subsections.heading: Cost Monitoring
subsections.content: Track real-time spending across the institution. Receive alerts for budget threshold breaches. Analyze cost-per-student metrics. Identify cost optimization opportunities.

subsections.heading: Model Management
subsections.content: Control access to premium AI models. Set usage limits for expensive models. Negotiate institutional pricing if available. Optimize model selection for cost efficiency.

sections.heading: Security and Compliance
sections.content: Maintain data security and regulatory compliance.

subsections.heading: Data Security
subsections.content: Monitor data access patterns. Review security audit logs. Implement data encryption standards. Manage user authentication requirements.

subsections.heading: Privacy Compliance
subsections.content: Ensure FERPA compliance for student data. Manage consent and disclosure requirements. Handle data deletion requests. Maintain privacy policy documentation.

subsections.heading: Incident Response
subsections.content: Develop incident response procedures. Document and investigate security events. Coordinate with IT security teams. Communicate incidents to stakeholders.

sections.heading: Support and Training
sections.content: Provide support and training resources for your institution.

subsections.heading: Instructor Training
subsections.content: Organize platform onboarding sessions. Provide AI literacy workshops. Share best practices documentation. Create instructor support channels.

subsections.heading: Student Resources
subsections.content: Develop student orientation materials. Create AI usage tutorials. Establish help desk procedures. Maintain FAQ documentation.

subsections.heading: Technical Support
subsections.content: Coordinate with platform support team. Escalate critical issues promptly. Maintain known issues documentation. Communicate updates to users.

sections.heading: Best Practices
sections.content: Guidelines for effective institutional AI management.

subsections.heading: Change Management
subsections.content: Plan phased rollouts of new features. Communicate changes well in advance. Gather feedback from stakeholders. Adjust policies based on outcomes.

subsections.heading: Stakeholder Engagement
subsections.content: Regular meetings with department heads. Student feedback collection mechanisms. Board reporting and updates. Community communication strategies.

subsections.heading: Continuous Improvement
subsections.content: Regular review of usage patterns. Benchmark against peer institutions. Adopt emerging best practices. Iterate on policies and procedures.
